title: Similar to Hamburgefonstiv
content:
Looking for the font used in the rio grande logo. I know I have seen this before I just can't remember where.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [riogrande.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831093803/http:/typophile.com/files/riogrande.jpg) | 182.99 KB |
author: glenwood

comments.content: “rio grande” is [Titanschrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831093803/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rmu/titanschrift/) or [Herkimer Bunrab](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831093803/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/herkimer-bunrab-nf/) as an alternative.
Also: Canada Type's revival of Titanic - [Lexington](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831093803/http:/old.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/lexington/).

Originally a Wagner & Schmidt type first cast around 1905, once known as Stanley. Jan & Mike have posted links to Amsterdam's 1926 version, Hercules, and Wagner's 1927 revision, Titan.  
Don't miss the alts with bunny ear ascenders [& descenders]. Not on the rio grande sign, but an entertaining art deco splash!  
Don
